item.title: Lido's market share in the Ethereum staking market has dropped to 25.02%, the lowest since March 2022.
item.description: On July 24th, based on Dune Analytics, Lido's share in the Ethereum staking market has decreased to 25.02%, which is the lowest level since March 2022.

item.title: Publicly traded company Satsuma has completed a funding round exceeding ￡100 million, aiming to accelerate its Bitcoin accumulation strategy.
item.description: On July 24th, the UK-listed company Satsuma Technology PLC (formerly known as Tao Alpha PLC) announced that it had successfully raised significantly over ￡100 million.The company's Chief Bitcoin Strategy Officer, Mark Moss, said: "We are extremely grateful for the strong market support demonstrated by this successful fundraising, which has exceeded our ￡100 million target. This attests to the UK market's confidence in Satsuma's strategic direction and the execution capabilities of our leadership team. With this expanded capital base, we anticipate providing a platform in London to drive the future development of decentralized infrastructure, expedite our Bitcoin accumulation strategy, and enhance our role in promoting institutional Bitcoin adoption in Europe."It was previously reported by BlockBeats that on July 14th, the UK-listed company Tao Alpha announced its first purchase of 28.56 BTC.

item.title: SenseTime Plans to Raise HKD 2.5 Billion, Funds to Be Used for RWA, Stablecoin, and Digital Asset Businesses
item.description: On July 24th, SenseTime announced that on July 23rd (after the trading hours of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange), the company placed 1.667 billion subscription shares. The expected total placement amount is approximately 2.5 billion Hong Kong dollars. After deducting placement agent fees and other related expenses, the net proceeds from the placement are approximately 2.498 billion Hong Kong dollars. The subscriber in this placement is the international long-term capital Infini Capital.The proceeds from this round of placement will mainly be used to support the company's core business development. This includes building an industry-leading AI cloud and continuously expanding the scale and scene coverage of the AI infrastructure SenseTime Data Center. It also involves exploring the technical integration and practical application of artificial intelligence in innovative vertical fields, such as implementing embodied intelligent robots, blockchain, real-world assets (RWA), digital assets,

item.title: ZORA Surges Over 43% in 24 Hours, Continuing Multi-Day Rally
item.description: On July 24th, based on HTX market data, ZORA witnessed a surge of more than 43% in the past 24 hours and maintained its multi-day upward trend. It is currently trading at $0.0543, with the market capitalization rising to $189 million.

item.title: Analysis: US Stablecoins Still Treated as Property for Tax Purposes, "GENIUS Act" Does Not Change Taxation Rules
item.description: On July 24th, as per Forbes, despite the recent passage of the GENIUS Act in the United States, the Internal Revenue Service still regards digital assets as property and maintains the key tax rules unchanged for traders and investors.The GENIUS Act imposes strict reserve, auditing, and disclosure requirements on U.S. stablecoin issuers, such as 1:1 asset backing and monthly financial audits; however, the act did not reclassify stablecoins for tax purposes.

item.title: Crypto Industry Calls on Trump to Block JPMorgan's 「Punitive Tax」 on Data Access
item.description: On July 24th, as per the report by CoinDesk, ten financial technology and cryptocurrency trade associations such as the Blockchain Association and the Crypto Council for Innovation have implored President Trump to prevent big banks from imposing fees that might impede innovation and competition. These organizations have cautioned that JPMorgan's plan to charge for accessing consumer banking data could result in millions of Americans losing their bank accounts and potentially hamper the adoption of stablecoins (USDC, USDT) and self-hosted wallets.The CFPB's open banking rule enables consumers to freely obtain bank data, but this rule is now in jeopardy as banks have filed lawsuits to block it, and the CFPB has requested to revoke the rule. At the core of this dispute lies how Americans fund digital wallets and exchanges. Aggregators like Plaid and MX enable consumers to transfer funds from bank accounts to platforms like Coinbase or Kraken. These connections rely on direct access to u

item.title: U.S. Stock Crypto Concept Stocks See Mixed Pre-market Movement, Tron Up 5.77%
item.description: On July 24th, in the pre-market trading of US stock cryptocurrency concept stocks, the results were mixed. They included:· Tron increased by 5.77%;· Sharplink Gaming decreased by 0.97%;· Circle declined by 1.54%;· Strategy rose by 0.24%;· Coinbase went up by 0.25%;· HOOD rose by 1.20%;· BMNR increased by 1.80%.

item.title: Elympics Airdrop Lookup is now live
item.description: On July 24th, Elympics, a multi-chain entertainment infrastructure, announced that the airdrop query is now available. The scope of airdrop eligibility includes:· The top 1600 Respect recipients.· The top 500 Cookie DAO Snapshot #1 users.· Cookie stakers in Elympics' multi-airdrop incentive event.BlockBeats previously reported that on July 23rd, Gate will launch Elympics (ELP) spot trading for the first time at 20:00 on July 24th, 2025 (UTC+8).

item.title: Republic of Ghana Plans to Issue License to Cryptocurrency Platforms
item.description: On July 24th, according to Bloomberg, the Republic of Ghana is making plans to issue licenses to cryptocurrency platforms. The authorities' goal is to regulate the asset class that is used by millions in this West African country while also generating revenue.The governor of the Bank of Ghana stated that the central bank is finalizing a regulatory framework that is intended to be submitted to Parliament for review in September. The proposed legislation would allow the country to fully utilize cryptocurrency, facilitate cross-border trade, attract strategic investments, and collect financial data.

item.title: Sky DeFi continues to utilize Staking Rewards to buy back SKY tokens
item.description: On July 24th, according to the monitoring of @EmberCN, Rune, a co-founder of Sky (formerly MakerDAO), is continuously using the staking rewards of SKY to repurchase SKY.He claimed the SKY staking rewards half an hour ago: 1.9 million USDS + 10.378 million SPK (approximately $1.3 million), and then transferred it to his buyback address. Currently, he is selling SPK to repurchase SKY.
